title: Modena
content: It took too long, but i managed to release Modena yesterday on [www.newlyn.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011174604/http:/www.newlyn.com/ "www.newlyn.com")
author: miles

comments.content:
Congrats Miles.  
You're lucky this style has stayed hip all these years! :-)

hhp
Great news! I've worked with the custom versions for HMRC and 3 already, and been really admiring them. I've been eagerly waiting for the final release!

Very nice font! :)  
Keep up the good work!

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel

Modena… Nice homage to my city… :)  
At least (unlike me) you always manage to release them, in the end…

The new site is great, Miles! I like it (and the logo!) a lot…

I have noticed the Ferox PDF with my old interview has two errors: my surname is mispelled "Puccinini" on the first page, and (despite the intentions) I have not released anything up to date with Rodrigo at Psy-Ops. So it should read just "Emigre and Village"…

Hi Claudio,  
I will make those ammends when the chance comes up, thanks for the kind words.

Miles

[www.newlyn.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011174604/http:/www.newlyn.com/ "www.newlyn.com")

hi miles, modena is great!

any plans to release a version of verona?

i love both!

We open in Venice,  
We next play Verona,  
Then on to Cremona.  
Lotsa quail in Cremona.  
Our next jump is Parma,  
That heartless, tartless menace,  
Then Mantua, then Padua,  
Then we open again, where?  
In Venice!

(Kiss me Kate)
